bibl.title: Nicagoras of Athens and the Lateran Obelisk.
bibl.note: The obelisk-project, as conceived by Constantine. The agent to whom he entrusted the negotiations with the priests at Thebes had to be a reliable and respected pagan. Nicagoras, who was in Thebes in 326, was exactly that. Cf. I. Syringes 1265; 1889.
bibl.seg: Fowden Garth, Nicagoras of Athens and the Lateran Obelisk.

The obelisk-project, as conceived by Constantine. The agent to whom he entrusted the negotiations with the priests at Thebes had to be a reliable and respected pagan. Nicagoras, who was in Thebes in 326, was exactly that. Cf. I. Syringes 1265; 1889.
